reviews.review_msg: Dr. Ro is nice and tries to do her best to convey the course material. The course itself however is all over the place in terms of content, and as it being the first time she was teaching it, the class and TA's were left wondering what's going on frequently. I know she had personal problems this sem but it led to a lot of disorganized mess for us.

In terms of Dr. Tucker she is a nice enough prof. I personally felt like she picked favourites which made participating in class less enjoyable. Her lectures are 3 hours of pointless she just rambles and covers easy stuff and skips harder material. Her lectures are somewhat clear but I taught myself a lot. WAY TO MANY assignments and papers!!!!!!!!

Cecilia is the best! She's so kind and makes everything so accessible to students. Also super inclusive and socially aware, which makes students feel comfortable in her class. Always open to feedback from us and really puts students first in her teaching! Posts slides & assignment info early and is so organized/structured too. Definitely recommend!

I thoroughly enjoyed being in Cecilia's class. You can tell that she is passionate about the topics that were being taught. She also tried her best to be inclusive and offered a wide range of perspectives with the readings that she assigned weekly. It may seem like that there's a lot of work to do on a weekly basis but it's definitely manageable.
I love this professor! She is such a sweetheart with engaging lectures and a lovely personality. She is very happy to help too and super easy to ask questions.

Overall the course was easy and the assignments were not hard. However, you need to study a bit more for the exams. One thing that annoyed me was that she said she only would curve the final if needed and mentioned this in the syllabus. However, when she posted the grades my A- was dropped to B-!! She said that its according to the grading policy

Professor Heredia is one of the sweetest and most patient HSCI professors I have ever had. She is so understanding, her assignments, participation quizzes, and exams are all super straightforward. She is so accessible outside of class and goes out of her way to help you out!

This lady should just teach all the HSCI classes in the faculty. In addition to being accessible and passionate, she actually makes sure you learn the material and doesnt throw random unnecessary facts for you to memorize. Straightforward class with excellent teaching format.

Cecilia is the most engaging and passionate HSCI prof I have ever had at SFU. She is very easy to contact through email and usually replies within the same day. All assignments and exams were straightforward and grading was always fair. Would recommend her to anyone!

One of the best profs. Very caring and wants her students to do well! Homework assignments are fair and easy to do. Exams are all based off of her lectures which are clear and not lengthy. Take a class with her!

Exams are straight forward and straight from the lecture slides. The second writing assignment is pretty difficult, but overall its not a very difficult class. You could probably get a decent mark without going to class if you don't care about the iclicker/attendance mark.

if you need to take hsci307, take it with her! she made the class super easy to understand and straight to the point. the exams were things taught in lecture, no surprises. the two writing assignments were a bit hard. she's such a sweet person as well. one of my favourite professors at SFU !!

Very sweet professor who cares a lot about her students and their success. She tries her best to make preliminary epidemiology to be interesting, and frequently had guest lecturers to break the monotony. Her assignments were fairly easy, and the large term paper was fairly graded and fun to write.

Professor McClymont is my favourite professor by far at SFU! She is thorough and explains the material well with examples. She is very caring, relatable, and always prepared. Would recommend attending lectures as she makes them easy to follow and understand. Overall great prof - would recommend her for this course.

I would encourage taking courses with Professor McClymont! The course material is straightforward and relatable to other health sciences courses. Exams were fairly easy. Talk to her after class or during office hours will definitely help getting a better grade! If you're ever unsure about your work, check-in with her and your TA! Very approachable!

Amazing professor. Her lectures were straight to the point and she did not stray off onto irrelevant topics. She only took 45 minutes for most lectures, but the full two hours are not needed if lectures are succinct and clear. She cares about her students and answers questions thoroughly. I recommend taking this class with her.

If you can read then theirs no point of attending lectures because she reads directly off the slides in a monotone voice and the average length of lecture is about 45 minutes in a supposed to be 2 hour lecture.

Dr. Currie is a hard grader and her TAs won't mark your work right unless it's exactly what was written on the answer sheet. This prof is strict but her tests are pretty straightforward as long as you memorize all the notes. Remember to memorize the notes!!!!!

boring class but Lauren had decent slides and fair tests. Lots of writing but that is the format from the prof who created the course not Lauren. Tophat really sucked cos half the time she asked only one question when class started. She tested a little bit from readings but you could survive without them. I felt she was willing to help when I asked

Currie is definitely by far one of the worst professor's I've ever encountered. She is currently teaching Hsci1120 at Langara College and I can honestly say I'm glad I dropped out. Attending lectures are not mandatory as she only reads directly from her slides. She doesn't know the answers to the questions that students' ask most of the time.

Really boring lecturer. With 2 papers, a midterm, homework assignments, and a final exam it was a very heavy course load. Her exams consisted of memorizing the lecture notes and textbook readings. Her voice will make you want to fall asleep in lectures, but make sure you attend as the participation was worth a lot in the end and makes a difference.

The class itself wasn't difficult but her grading criteria and style is inexplicable. You won't know what you're being marked on until you get your paper back with nit picky comments docking entire marks. First homework assignment of four questions (Wanted definition of terms) was out of 95 marks inexplicably. Would not recommend at all.

Lauren Currie is easily one of the worst professors at SFU. She is rude and truly believes she is superior to those around her. Absolutely NO constructive feedback from her or her AWFUL teaching assistants. The marking is SUPER subjective, regardless if it the huge/irrelevant paper we have to write, or the assignments. Just Awful.

TAs in this course can make or break. Be very careful which one you get! Saw the same TA regularly lower students marks if they  asked questions about their assignments, or even just for an explanation of what they missed. Even showed the class on the projector her lowering a students mark infront of everyone! Lauren herself is a meh lecturer.

I took her class last year fall.. Grading criteria unclear and basically depends on who marked ur exam or paper meaning someone could get a question wrong while you got the same answer right & if you ask about why you got deducted grades or a remarking you'll get deducted even more i.e go from 80% to 70%. 8:30 iclicker no grade if you come at 8:35.

If you hand in your assignment one minute pass the deadline it will be marked late and you will be deducted 10-20%. Hand in all your assignments on time and get to class before 8:30. MC questions on exams are tricky, make sure to read the textbook thoroughly, no need to read slides. You don't need to go to lectures other than for pop quizzes.

A prof makes or breaks your over all experience in a class and how well you do in the course. Lauren is not available for extra help, nor are her TAs. TOPHAT is mandatory to purchase in order to participate in class but she used it for 5 questions total in the course and the rest were pop quizzes in class at 8:30am.

In all my years at SFU, Lauren is probably the worst prof I've had. Lectures at 830am are pointless because she literally reads right off the slides in a monotone voice and the exact same info is in the textbook. Makes attendance mandatory by using tophat but stopped using it halfway .Waste of money. Not very friendly and not very accommodating.

Hardly any clarification or grading rubric for an incredibly long paper. She seems like a nice person and replies quickly, but makes a pretty bad prof. She's also very monotone and having an 8:30 lecture made it difficult to pay attention. The grading is unclear and feedback is minimal, but that might have more to do with the TA.

Seems unapproachable (can be intense), but 1 on 1, she's super helpful and caring. The course itself wasn't very organised in the beginning, but it got better. You have to study for exams, but there's a lot of cross-over in material and you only need to focus on lecture slides. START THE FINAL PAPER EARLY, get help and you'll do well!

I personally thought Denise was was a great lecturer! You can tell she is passionate about this course and wants students to succeed. She does challenge you when it comes to the midterm and final but, is very helpful during office hours! Be prepared to work for a good grade
Denise is very knowledgeable in this subject and has taught the course MANY times. Her tests are fair but challenging and the paper for this course takes a long time to do so get started soon!

The only good about the course is: Midterms and final is pretty fair. Only complaint is final included too much stuff from before the midterm. The papers were brutal, average tends to be 50-60%. She does not lecture very well or care about her students. Avoid if you can

I haven't had a worse proff. The material isn't difficult but the marking was ridiculous and she herself is terrible teacher. Never had a proff who is so unhelpful and defensive when the whole class is doing terribly. Do not like her as a person

Her kindness during lecture is a facade. Not a fair grader. Take this class with anyone but her. Textbook covers too much material, although she recommends that you buy it (since she wrote it) it is not needed.

She's insanely rude and unhelpful. Her exams were fair but her papers were ridiculously hard with no background context given for them. Not to mention the marking was extremely unfair. She makes u buy the textbook even though she wrote the damn thing and you barely use it. She took attendance and random pop quizzes during lecture.

If you don't remember word for word what she said in lecture, and reproduce it on the exam, she won't give you any marks, not even half marks.   There are a few essays that are very long, but worth low percentages.  Overall unfair course, hard to approach professor (just tells you to go look in the text book).  Take this course with anyone but her.

She's actually really thorough. I don't know what the fuss is about, some students are just lazy and want a short cut by going to office hours to please the prof. Well sorry- no this is university. No pain no gain. Her lecture notes are the most organized and clear-cut than any HSCI prof so far!

I personally liked most of the format of the course, 4 smaller homework assignments and 2 papers. The second paper though is A LOT of work (over 16 pages) and only worth 10%.  So much of the course is spent building up to this paper, and not enough preparing for the final (worth 25%) which slaughtered most of the class.

AVOID going to her office hrs. Not only she doesnt want to help you but she is SOOO RUDE. she tends to get defensive for no reason. She doesnt care about her students at all and it seems like she wants everyone to do bad in her class. regret having her as my prof!

Health science profs at SFU that I have come across are usually pretty great, but this one falls at the other end of the scale. She is horrible. Reads off slides in lecture, horrible attitude towards students, very picky marker, doesn't like people that smell good, gives pointless pop quizzes, and the list goes on.

The content of this class is not too difficult. There seems to be a disconnect between her and her TAs. What the TAs say to be correct turns out to be marked incorrectly. She is very rude about her sensitivity to scents and makes everybody feel victimized by the way that she handles it. I find lectures to be pointless but she has tricky pop quizzes

worst professor ever! she is rude, quick to get defensive. Unwilling to help and put time for students during office hours. she is unwilling to give students time to see their exams. Although she has a PHD she is INCREDIBLY RUDE. DO NOT go to her office hours if you dont wish to be insulted. Im not sure why she is still teaching in this university
Great Proff. If you read the textbook and attend lectures, you should do well in this course. Very organized and interesting course overall.

She is very organized and interested in what she's teaching. Research methods isn't a very exciting topic, but because Denise knows about it and is interested in it, she has managed to make the class very engaging! But there are no quiz preps for the tricky quizzes, but aside from that, she has made the course very interesting.
her lectures were not consistently clear. she was not helpful when asked to clarify. i found her to be rude and condescending to students.
Group project needs to be revised. Great lecture slides- very clear

Of all the HSCI courses I've taken, this class is the worst.  The course itself is not so bad, it's the prof. It is difficult to understand her, even her lecture notes are more clear than her. She shows no compassion for her students; shows a cold personality when you approach her.
Absolutely awful. DO NOT take a course with her unless absolutely necessary.

WORST PROF EVER. very unclear and difficult to understand. gets defensive quite easily. I've taken many hsci courses with the profs at sfu.. and she is definitely the worst. DO NOT take a class with her unless you ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO!

Denise has an obvious passion and interest in what she is teaching and uses her previous research work to explain specific examples covered in class. Her teaching style is not one that most undergrads would prefer (one with straight notes and memorization). Her class is taught with the expectation that everyone comes prepared and ready to learn

Denise is one of the best professors I have ever had. I had no interest in research methods before I came to class and I ended up leaving with a good interest. She only uses her work as an example to exmplain the lecture topics and this semester there was a take-home midterm, final, h/w exercises and a group research project.

I loved Denise's enthusiasm and obvious passion for health research. To do well, it is necessary to attend every lecture and keep up with all assigned reading, as obscure questions tended to pop up on her exams. She is very approachable and interesting to talk to as she always made me feel welcome during her office hours.
